subject: problem with reading testdata.xml from jtestcase script
msgSnippet: Hi, I have the java script to read Jtestcase xml file. here is my script: public void testTitle() throws Exception { String dataFile = testdata.xml ;
messageBody:
Hi,

I have the java script to read Jtestcase xml file. here is my script:
public void testTitle() throws Exception {

String dataFile = "testdata.xml";
System.out.println("start...");
JTestCase data = new JTestCase(dataFile,"Inbox");
Vector testCases = data.getNameOfTestCases("testTitle");
System.out.println("after getName");
for (int i=0;i<testCases.size(); i++){
System.out.println("testcase["+i+"]"+testCases.elementAt(i));
}

I am try to read the test data xml file. My xml file like this:
<?xml version ="1.0" encoding = "UTF-8"?>
<tests xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://jtestcase.sourceforge.net/config/jtest
case.xsd">
<class name="Inbox">
<method name="testTitle" test-case="positive">
<params>
<param name="var1" type="int">10</param>
</params>
</method>
</class>
</tests>

when i run my test script, it generate this error:
[Warning] at line number, 2: Valid documents must have a <!DOCTYPE
declaration.
[Error] at line number, 2: Element type "tests" is not declared.
[Error] at line number, 2: Attribute "xmlns:xsi" is not declared for element
"te
sts".

I did try to add <!DOCTYPE in my xml file but still not work.
How can I fix this problem?

Any help is appreciated.

Thanks,
Denny
